channel.title: Homes on Matt Stine
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Matt Stine

item.description: Biography Matt Stine is an 19 year veteran of the enterprise IT industry, with seven of those years spent as a consulting solutions architect for multiple Fortune 500 companies, as well as the not-for-profit St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital. He is the author of Migrating to Cloud-Native Application Architectures from O’Reilly, and the host of the Software Architecture Radio podcast. Matt spends much of his time thinking about lean/agile software development methodologies, DevOps, architectural principles/patterns/practices, and programming paradigms, in an attempt to find the perfect storm of techniques that will allow corporate IT organizations to not only function like startup companies, but also create software that delights users while maintaining a high degree of conceptual integrity.

Ian Malcolm on Software Development On Orchestrated Microservices Build self-healing distributed systems with Spring Cloud Leave the Campground Cleaner On Gaelyks and Golden Hammers Executable Specifications: Automating Your Requirements Document Is the Apple JVM an “Extra Feature?” Automation for the People (because Everybody Doing It Manually Hurts) Build Scripts? We Don’t Need No Stinkin’ Build Scripts! Failed Metric, Failed Build? Yes You Kanban! Modular Agile: Loosely coupled, highly cohesive ceremonies Think You’re “Doing Kanban?
